name: places/ChIJl3GCkJtZwokRdwxzDrGAFh4
formattedAddress: 2 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10003-8099, USA

editorialSummary.text: No-frills lodging in a historic walk-up property with a/c, private baths & a pizzeria/sports bar.

originalText.text:
We booked this place with the intention of never really being there except to sleep, and that's precisely what we did. Therefore, it was great! We would be out and about in the city all day, then be able to take the subway to within walking distance of the hotel at the end of the day.
Pros: they make your bed each day, they are very kind and helpful, they were willing to try to get me a room on the lowest level (but it turned out they were booked), we went in the winter and it was freezing cold outside but the tiny floor heater heated the space VERY well (we were sweating at some points!), no bugs, great location, hot showers. The beds are very firm, but we prefer that (I know some do not). At the end of each day, when we got back to our room after walking 8-10 miles all over the city, we would crash and sleep very well all night.
Cons: no elevator, the stairs are very steep and narrow, the place is outdated in decor (this could be spun as a positive if you love feeling and seeing the history from the building). There was no window view from our room, which was slightly disappointing. The TV appears to only have bunny-ear antenna channels from the 80s (but who cares, we were just there to sleep). We were NOT there in the summer, but I can imagine it would get pretty hot during that time of year.
Bottom line: If you are looking for an affordable, clean, and safe place to sleep, this is your place.
NOTE: They only take cash.

originalText.text: I should’ve listened to the reviews. I decided to over look the bad reviews as the complaints were minor and I wasn’t planning on staying in and just sleeping. On arrival my check-in was smooth, be aware that it’s CASH ONLY. The staff working the front desk on arrival was very kind and helpful with getting my bags to my room. My room was unfortunately on the 3rd level of hotel, be aware again that they DONT have an elevator. So I had to climb what felt like 6 flights of narrow stairs. Once inside my room, I noticed that it was quite outdated, but clean. I left my things without giving it another thought and went on my day long expedition of the city. When I returned I decided to shower. To my misfortune the shower handle fell off and I was unable to shower. Again, I didn’t make a big deal and decided to just head to bed and let the front desk attendant know the next morning. Let me just say that was the worst night of sleep that I have ever had. The mattress was super uncomfortable, offering absolutely no back relief from the long day. I woke up feeling sore all over. The pillows weren’t any better. They appeared to have been old lumpy pillows. I’m assuming they were the cheapest pillows they could buy and had washed them to get them to that state. Laying down I finally got a look at the ceiling as saw what appeared to be a leak starting or patched over leak. During the night I could hear everything happening around me, especially people going down the stairs with their suitcases. The next morning, I decided for my sanity that I wouldn’t stay another night fretting it would be a nightmare like the night before. The front desk attendant working that morning was absolutely of no help and didn’t even offer a partial refund considering I had only spent one night of my four night stay. They simply offered me a different room on the second level. I refused and decided to just cut my losses and book the next available hotel room in the area. The only pro that this hotel had was the price and location.

originalText.text:
Good budget hotel with small rooms and private bathrooms. The location is great for exploring NYC. The subway is close by.
This is a good stay only if you need basic amenities and a clean bed to sleep after a long day of exploring the city. If you plan on staying in the hotel for most part of your trip, maybe look elsewhere.
Friendly and helpful staff. They accept cash only.

Friendly and helpful staff. They accept cash only.

originalText.text: Stayed for a week. Best value for money option in New York by far. Hotel is very charming. Service and hospitality are great! Location is EXTREMELY convenient and close to many spots in Manhattan.

text.text: Stayed for a week. Best value for money option in New York by far. Hotel is very charming. Service and hospitality are great! Location is EXTREMELY convenient and close to many spots in Manhattan.

originalText.text: We stayed for 1 week and enjoyed the great location to easily use the Metro bus system. Friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable rooms for restful sleep.

text.text: We stayed for 1 week and enjoyed the great location to easily use the Metro bus system. Friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable rooms for restful sleep.
